channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Ben Rhodes Keeps Getting It Wildly Wrong on Israel and Gaza
item.description: Setting the record straight on the recent New York Times screed by Obama’s deputy national security adviser.

item.title: Citadel’s shot at Andreessen Horowitz points to coming battle over DeFi and U.S. stock trading
item.description: Tokenized stocks are gaining popularity, but a trading giant owned by billionaire Ken Griffin wants to hit the breaks.

item.title: NYC mayor-elect tells residents how to resist ICE agents knocking at their door in new video

item.title: The workforce is becoming AI-native. Leadership has to evolve
item.description: The new generation began university when ChatGPT launched in 2022 and they now account for roughly half of all ChatGPT usage.

item.title: Why State Courts Should Not Set National Energy Policy
item.description: Judges are improperly turning courts into bastions of climate activism.

item.title: Report: Hegseth Gave Order to Kill Boat Operators Because They Were on a Target List
item.description: Is the Trump administration claiming the power to do what previous administrations have done: compile lists of ‘enemy combatants’ and kill them?

item.title: Netflix needs Warner Bros.’s IP and franchises to remain the default streaming service
item.description: Also: All the news and watercooler chat from Fortune.

item.title: Fortune Brainstorm AI San Francisco starts today, with Databricks, OpenAI, Cursor, and more on deck
item.description: Today, Fortune Brainstorm AI starts, and so many key players in AI will be with us live in San Francisco.

item.title: The science of failing up: Why some leaders rise despite repeated screwups
item.description: Inside corporate America’s hidden mechanics that allow executives to fail upward.

item.title: Pope Leo Reveals His Secret
item.description: What a 17th-century monk can still teach us.

item.title: Congress unveils $900B defense bill targeting China with tech bans, investment crackdown, US troop pay raise
item.description: Congress passes $900B defense bill targeting China with new investment restrictions, military technology bans, and 4% pay raise for troops nationwide.

item.title: Rein In the Presidential Pardon Power
item.description: A bipartisan pattern of executive abuse shows why the unilateral power to pardon should be reconsidered.

item.title: Omar doubts Minnesota fraud linked to terrorism, warns of harms of Trump calling Somalians 'garbage'

item.description: American teenagers have a fractured relationship with the federal government, one that may never be healed.

item.title: Today In Republicans Being Useless: House GOPers Surrender On Obamacare Fight
item.description: By every measure, the GOP is more useless than that raccoon that broke into an ABC store, got drunk, and passed out on the bathroom floor.
